name: SAS Institute
bossPosition: Executive Vice President, Chief Legal Officer and Corporate Secretary
goal: Founded in 1976, SAS is the leader in analytics. Through innovative analytics, business intelligence and data management software and services, SAS helps customers make better decisions faster. SAS has customers in 149 countries. Our software is installed at more than 83,000 business, government and university sites.
interests: Consumer Affairs, Customs, Economic and Financial Affairs, Education, Employment and Social Affairs, Enterprise, Foreign and Security Policy and Defence, General and Institutional Affairs, Information Society, Internal Market, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Research and Technology, Taxation, Trade
euInitiatives:
SAS has an interest in a wide range of EU policies and legislation given the breadth of the SAS offering across several industries. In no particular order and non-exhaustively, these are some of the main EU policies and files covered in 2017:
-Data Protection and Privacy
-Intellectual Property Rights
-Big data
-Free flow of data
-Artificial intelligence & machine learning
-The Internet of Things
-Customs and Trade
-Digital Economy
-Digital Single Market
